alert.note: Alert for Marshall; St. Joseph; Starke (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 7:44AM EST until February 22 at 8:30AM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana... Yellow River at Plymouth affecting Marshall, Starke and St. Joseph IN Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Kankakee River at Davis affecting Starke, La Porte and St. Joseph IN Counties. .The combination of snowmelt and 1 to 2 inches of rainfall led to rises on area rivers. Rises could shift ice in the river that could lead to ice jams. This forecast is based on unobstructed flow and does not factor additional rises associated with ice jams. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Yellow River at Plymouth. * WHEN...Until Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 14.5 feet, The parking lot on Laporte Street begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 AM EST Friday /5:45 AM CST Friday/ the stage was 12.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late this afternoon to 14.5 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage Monday morning to 11.3 feet and begin rising again early Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
